name: Holiday Inn SunSpree Resort Montego Bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got back from Montego Bay. It was our first trip in Jamaica. We really enjoyed it. especialy the trip to the Dunn's river Falls. The hotel is too big for the small land they have. Rooms need to be refreshed and the furniture is too old!!! THEY ARE BEGING TO BE REPLACED! If you want to open the balcony door, you need to be strong. We were staying in the building 1 and the room 1405. Besides off this the quality food was good but the selection was poor. There was no seafood and there wasn't enough fruits. There is no wine during the diner. The beach is very small and the beach chairs need to be replaced. There is not enough place, on the beach, where you can hide from the sun. The evening entertainment is good, especialy the live music. Staff are friendly, we would like to thank the front desk employe Roudney Stewart.
reviews.title: The taste of Jamaica!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Holiday Inn from August 29-September 5 and it was great. I travel frequently and will start by saying that I am not really one for all inclusive resorts (I prefer B&Bs or guest houses to get a more intimate encounter with the country I am visiting) but never the less my holiday was great.
reviews.title: Had a Great Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before I start I will also say that occupancy seemed to be quite low so this review may not be representative of busier times.
reviews.title: Lucky to Have Gotten This Deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: CHECK-IN
reviews.title: Geat Time To Be Had for a Bargain!

reviews.text: Quick and painless. The manager was there handing out wrist bands to people standing in line to speed things up and of course a welcome drink of rum puch followed. It took no more than 15 minutes from drop off to getting our room keys. I asked for a room in building 5 and of course was told No Problem.
reviews.title: i loved it and wish i could go back right now!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok, we signed up for the Priority Club before we left, it was free to sign up and we figured it couldn't hurt if it helped us get through check in faster. We read all of the reviews for the past six weeks and almost changed hotels because of the reviews. We were nervous about the whole thing because of all of the bad reviews. So let me start by saying that Check in ran very smoothly. It took about 10 minutes to check in, they told us our room would not be ready until 3pm which we got there early about 11am. We let them know that we were priority and asked if we could get an upgrade. We also were teasing the guy at check in and told him to put us in the room he would stay in if he were staying! We walked around the resort, which was beautiful, and went back to check in about 130pm just to see if by chance our room was ready yet and it was!!!
reviews.title: So not as bad as others make it sound!

reviews.text: The room was fantastic, oceanfront, king size bed room, in building 7 beside the adult pool. It was fantastic. There were a few ants in the room but nothing major. The a/c worked fine, we had clean towels everyday, they even changed our sheets everyday.
reviews.title: Good value for money-great staff-all round very good!

reviews.text: The second night we were there the staff brought us complimentary fruit and water, which was really nice of them.
reviews.title: Holiday Inn from hell !

reviews.text: The food was good. Jerk chicken was excellent, the cheeseburgers were good, the cups were small but we took our own so it worked out fine. We never waited long for our drinks like everyone else complained about. The staff was courteous and very helpful.
reviews.title: roach motel/ dirty place

reviews.text: Now for the complaints, when we first got their we realized our cell phones did not work in the resort, we asked several times for help with the phones, we wanted to call home and check on the kids (really bad) and no one could tell us what to do. We called collect and by credit card from our room phone (which we found out cost $140 for 2 calls). Come to find out, there was 2 phones beside the restrooms down from the main lobby where you could call with your credit card and NO ONE bothered telling us that. Also later discovered if we walked accross the water to the island our phones worked.
reviews.title: Paradise - What More Can We Say

reviews.text: food was boreing,one week of it was enough.good night entertainment,weather was dreadful,never stopped raining all week.the excursions i had booked were cancelled and trying to get my money back was hard work.beware dont book with beverly from jamaica tours she doesnt want to refund you,unless you threaten to get the police.wouldnt go to montego bay again,am told ocho rios is much better and safer,although it didnt worry me crossing the road on my own to go to the shops.
reviews.title: you get what you pay for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I went to Holiday Inn Sunspree Sept 29-Oct 3rd. We stayed in a beautiful ocean front room. The view was amazing. It was very clean and the beds were very comfortable. Georgette from Guest Services checked on us the first day to make sure we were happy with our room and reservations (they had been made for us because we were redeeming Holiday Inn points). We found Winslow and the ladies at guest services to be very cordial and ready to help you. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I had read some of the previous reviews and was worried about the trip--I can only assume that these are the disgruntled few as my stay at the resort was wonderful. The food in the restaurants was very good. I particularly enjoyed the SeaBreeze Jamaican restaurant. My only piece of advice would be to try to upgrade and change up the buffet where possible. We also enjoyed the snorkeling. We had mentioned possibly coming back with our kids and David showed us some of the newly refurbished childrens rooms--these are going to be awesome. They have a private quarter with bunkbeds, a bean bag and a flat screen TV for the kids. There is also a kids desk and dryerase board for them to play with in the room. This will make a family vacation much nicer as you can have a little bit of seperation within the room--the adults could watch their own TV. This is a family resort, but we came as a couple for some R&R and we got it--it was wonderful! Thanks Holiday Inn Staff!
reviews.title: Wonderful Relaxing Vacation

reviews.text: Had a most relaxing and wonderful time. Snorkeling was great! The catamaran was fun, as well as the beach. Service was warm and friendly. The restaurants were very good. It is a family destination, but they have the adult only pool and side of the beach for a more romantic and quiet getaway. The bars onsite are nice as well. We were able to take our daughter, and still have some romantic dinners due to the onsite daycare. My daughter loved the caregivers there, and had a good time. The live evening shows are a gem and very entertaining! We will be going again :)
reviews.title: Family Fun for Everyone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My mum (who looks young) and I (aged 32 but look in my teens lol) have just returned from this hotel in beautiful Jamaica...We are not complete fuddy duddies and like a good clean laugh! We are very well travelled and enjoy fun as well as comfort...We are not ravers or partygoers, so this hotel was perfect for us. It may not suit those wanting to see the REAL JAMAICA (we are originally from here so we know the real deal) I said to my mum whilst on the beach (very shallow, gorgeous,child friendly clean water) that "...we may as well have been in Mexico rather that Jamaica" as if you never left the hotel you could really be anywhere in the world without seeing the real deal outside...
reviews.title: Nice enough Hotel...Star rating is accurate and food was ok/nice...

reviews.text: INITIAL EXPECTATIONS:
reviews.title: A high value hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back last night, we had a wonderful time. To start, we arrived at 10am, we were prepared to have to wait for a while to get our room, but sure enough, they let us in right away. I had called ahead and requested building 5 or 6, they said they were full and put us oceanview on 4th floor, building 7. Our view was incredible. We also had a large balcony that wrapped around our room, but we didn't use it too often,
reviews.title: Great Place for the $, Minor Problems....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As others have said, the beach is great. I feel the grounds were very well kept, and security is reassuring. There are 8 beaches, all about 30 yards long, so you can find a spot to settle with no problem. We also were able to find shade on all days. We snorkeled behind the small island and what a treat...We saw more fish than on our excursion. Water is warm, beach is clean and small fish were all over the place.
reviews.title: Had a wonderful time at the Sunspree

reviews.text: We ate at the Seabreeze the first night, it was Jamaican cusine, limited menu and a bit different than we were used to, but beachfront and a decent place overall.
reviews.title: Had a great time!

reviews.text: The buffet was adequate and had common items, pizza, chicken tenders and a few special dishes. You never left hungry, but never left feeling like you had a great meal. The pasta bar and omelette station were very good.
reviews.title: Best Holiday Ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate at Sorrento the last night, which was suposed to be resort elegant, but we some people in jeans. Oh well. The food was great. I had the filet wrapped in bacon and the apps were also good. This was the best meal I had.
reviews.title: Its not the Ritz, but it was worth the price (except for some of the food)

reviews.text: This was my 4th trip to Montego Bay in the past couple years, however my first time staying at Holiday Inn Sunspree.
reviews.title: Has potential, but employees need to lose their attitudes!

reviews.text: With that being said, I went in with no expectations and was well aware of the 'island pace' (everything is slowed down and chilled out)
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: CHECK-IN
reviews.title: Great value, awesome stay!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a group of 9 of us traveling down there to celebrate a couple birthdays. Check-in was hot (why do they not have any fans in that part of the resort?!) and rather long. Before arriving we had requested rooms next to each other, but weren't able to get that... in the beginning we weren't even all on the same floor.
reviews.title: SIMPLY FABULOUS

reviews.text: We arrived at 11am and didn't get our rooms until after 3pm. After talking to Ruklin (Rulkin?) we were given rooms on the same floor, (4th floor of building 1). He was very helpful and actually tried to coordinate so we would all be close to each other.
reviews.title: Ok for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my bf stayed at Holiday Inn Montego Bay from Aug 22-29. We came here to celebrate my Birthday and weren't disappointed even for a min!! The hotel is great! Everything is very close together so it takes less than 3 minutes to walk to the main building from bldg 5. And for everyone who write bad reviews here, well let's just say don't expect an equivalent of a Sandals resort when you pay under a $1000Cnd. incl. tax.
reviews.title: Jamaica is now my favourite place to go! The resort was AWESOME!!!!! Can't wait to go back!

reviews.text: Arrival:
reviews.title: Solid 3* hotel and service!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The ride from the airport is 10min, which is great because you don't arrive all tired from the trip. The front desk line up can be avoided with the priority club rewards card, even if you have a zero point balance on it! We called ahead of time to reserve bldg 5, but b/c our plane was the last out of 3 that day to arrive, all rooms in bldg. 5 were taken. Nevertheless, we spoke to the Nolitours rep the next day and she made sure we moved on the 3rd day into the most beautiful room on the 4th floor of bldg. 5, with a great ocean view on one side and mountain view on the other 9look at my pics!).
reviews.title: Gross, Don't walk barefooted!!

reviews.text: Rooms:
reviews.title: Fantastic time in the Sunspree, plenty to eat, drink and lots of sunshine.

reviews.text: Our first room was in bldg 3. Not that much difference from bldg. 5 except that we were on the 2nd floor, so no view and you got laundry ppl talking under your balcony at 7am, and we like to sleep in. Top floor rms in all bldgs have amazing views and high ceilings. The washroom is a bit tight, but lets face it, how much time do you spend in the washroom?? And they DO change the sheets every 3 days (unless you specifically hang up a sign saying you want them changed each day, which is very environmentally unfriendly!). Towels work the same way, and we always got them clean and fresh (i don't know why ppl make up stories that they didn't!)
reviews.title: Would Stay Again!

reviews.text: after reading alot of negative reviews i was a little nervous after spending alot of money on this holiday, but as soon as we arrived and were handed our rum punch whilst looking through the lobby to the pool and the beach i stopped worrying!
reviews.title: perfect for the children lovely relaxing holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the hotel was very beautifull and just perfect for my three children ages 4,6 and 7. the pool wasnt to deep and neither was the sea so i could relax knowing they could play safely. the kids club was excellent although it was quite while we were there.
reviews.title: Good if you're a priority member

reviews.text: lots of popcorn and ice cream on hand all day and lots of games for them to join in with aswell. also you never had to fight for a sun lounger ther were plenty all the time.
reviews.title: Okay for the price you pay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i found the brekfast to be the best meal of the day althought they were all yummy, the italian upstairs ws beautifull, a lovely dining experience!
reviews.title: lynda@ken excellent

reviews.text: the only fault i have is that the air conditioning unit in the bedroom was a little noisy and there wasnt really anywhere you could walk to outside the hotel but apart from that it was an excellent holiday and would definatly go there again!!!!!
reviews.title: It wasn't as good as the first time we stayed here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the best holiday in my life! Food fantastic, 3 restaurants which you have to book in the morning on the same day, 2 italian, one Caribbean( delicious food), also main restaurant, open for bfast lunch and dinner, no bookings required.several bars, open from 10am-2am, 2 fast food outlets( chipsa, sausages, burgers, jerk chicken, pork, hardo bread, nachos, hot-dos, ice-creams), plenty of food and drinks, all inclusive.all the staff great. room service so nice. water sports, snorkeling, kayaking, wind boat for free, bottom glass boat available for small fee, aerobic, entartanment in the evenig, karaoke, quizess for kids. jacuzii, big swimming pool with waterfalls, and one adult pool with a bar. free transfer to nightclubs(pier 1 only on fridAYS IS A MUST, great experience, margerita ville good as well, any day of the week.we were using local taxis(red plates) to get to town, paying 220 jamaican dollars (3 american dollars) instead of 20dollars for hotel taxis, went to local hairdresser and barber, went to ocho rios to swim with dolphins and climb up the waterfalls, and did few activities locally, bought it from our thomas cook agent at the hotel. take water shoes with you if you are planning any activities and waterproof camera! it was very hot when we went there and it was my first time in Caribbean but accommodated after one day. This is the best hotel in Montego BAy unless you are going to choose 4 or 5 star! we are definitely going there agin. good for families(they have a nursery and nannies at night), couples, groups, business
reviews.title: fantastic experience

reviews.text: How anyone could visit this hotel and not have a good time is beyond me. Having read some of the previous reviews I was a little worried but my fears were very soon laid to rest. The hotel complex has its own beach with a small island a short stroll across shallow water offering another place to sunbathe and relax.
reviews.title: Irie Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very clean and most of the staff are very friendly, the rooms are of a good standard with the usual facilities. My only complaints would be the general standard of food left a lot to be desired, internet use was almost prohibitively expensive and the door to my room looked had though it had been painted by someone who’d had far too much rum punch.
reviews.title: DONT GO WORST HOLIDAY IN JAMACIA

reviews.text: The Holiday Inn Sunspree is a place to relax and enjoy the Jamaican vibe, but be adventurous and see the real Jamaica too. Montego Bay was disappointing so I recommend you go much further afield, I went to Nine Mile in the middle of nowhere to see where Bob Marley was born. I went on an organised tour but wished I had taken a private taxi so I could have stopped off more.
reviews.title: Super Stay in Montego Bay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent a very enjoyable week there and would recommend Jamaica to anyone. I will certainly return and spend longer, although next time will spend less time in the hotel and more time seeing what this wonderful island has to offer.
reviews.title: Super vacation

description: *All rates displayed are All-Inclusive* When comparing Jamaica hotels, consider the All-Inclusive Holiday Inn SunSpree Resort Hotel-Montego Bay Jamaica. After an extensive renovation, this favorite Montego Bay hotel looks fantastic! The renewed color theme throughout the hotel will help you kick off your Jamaica vacation. A newly refreshed lobby, enhanced guestrooms with flat screen TV's, restaurants, beach and swimming and sunning areas make this Jamaica hotel better than ever. This Jamaica resort is located approximately 7 minutes from the Montego Bay International Airport. We offer an array of services as well as optional tours. Our wedding coordinator can help you plan your dream Caribbean wedding. Please look at our package page for more information. Conference facilities available. Children activity centre from 6 months to 12 years. The All- Inclusive Caribbean vacation includes room, non-motorized water sports, three delicious meals and snacks - buffet or a la carte. Please note: Some restaurants are not open every day and require reservations. See food and beverage section for schedules. Local brand cocktails and soft drinks. *Must advise arrival flight in info field when making reservations. Taxes and service charges included. Our property offers a courtesy lounge with luggage storage area and shower facilities.
